MacKinnon Professor of History, Arizona State University In a series of historical and contemporary meditations, David Pickus travels along China’s Grand Canal and takes the reader on a journey through time and space. With the acumen of a historian who can draw on years of experience living abroad, Pickus offers nuanced and personal reflections on globalization, transnationalism, and indeed what it means to live in a global village. Welcome to the journey! Michael Wutz Brady Presidential Distinguished Professor, Weber State University This book paints an objective portrait of China’s Grand Canal, and foregrounds the perspective of the author, an American visitor to China, who, in the words of Henry James, is “someone on whom nothing is lost.” David Pickus’s sensibility is a marvel of philosophical curiosity. An enthralling account of a highly educated American's reaction to his perception of China, yesterday and today! 作者简介

[

裴大卫(DavidPickus)出生于美国芝加哥,2013年移居中国,目前为浙江大学的“国际组织与国际发展项目”授课。1995年,他于芝加哥大学取得德国史博士学位。之后,他先后 赴詹姆斯 · 麦迪逊大学和亚利桑那州立大学教授历史和人文 学科相关课程。在此期间,大卫在塞尔维亚的贝尔格莱德居住了一年。来杭州之 前,他于2013年至2017年在中国人民大学教授世界历史。除了记录对中国的印象,大卫还致力于中欧和东欧历史、犹太文化 以及高等教育全球化的学术研究。他酷爱旅游,喜欢探索未知领域,也喜欢以全新视角解读他所熟悉的地方。

]
